intro: Psilogramme paucifolia, commonly known as the sparse-leaved psilogramme, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, fern-like leaves. It is native to arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky soils and dry climates. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are usually few in number, hence the species name "paucifolia," meaning "few-leaved." Psilogramme paucifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
